body:
Comment 2 by **Dan.Glastonbury**: 
Curiously, this morning when I ran ./all.bash all tests pass...

I tried to repo my steps from yesterday. I removed my clone of go and fetched it
again. hg log -l 1 shows that it was the same version. And, once again ./all.bash has
all tests pass.

These are my machine's version and gcc version:
$ uname -a
Darwin Dans-MacBook-Pro.local 10.0.0 Darwin Kernel Version 10.0.0: Fri Jul 31
22:47:34 PDT 2009; root:xnu-1456.1.25~1/RELEASE_I386 i386
$ gcc -version
686-apple-darwin10-gcc-4.2.1: no input files

And the output from the test you requested:
$ cd  test/
$ 8g 64bit.go 
$ 8l 64bit.8 
$ ./8.out >tmp.go
$ wc tmp.go
   11683  111813 1340668 tmp.go
$ md5 -r tmp.go 
ceb45a4b7755aa80641e1a08848d7df4 tmp.go
